p: A closely related leaf roller, Salbia haemorrhoidalis was used in successful programs for the biological control of Lantana camara in South Africa. This species showed good establishment and distribution in this country, as well as high population densities ( Baars 2003). Another great advantage of employing S. lotanalis as a biocontrol agent is that it can be easily reared under laboratory conditions, with high population growth rates (Morais et al. 2010).
